block.p: Air Canada posted a 16 percent gain in revenue to 1.6 billion Canadian dollars in the first quarter and trimmed its operating loss by two-thirds, to 5 million Canadian dollars. The Montreal-based airline's net loss was 34 million Canadian dollars, or 28 Canadian cents a share, compared with a loss of 6 million Canadian dollars, or 3 cents, a year earlier. The 1999 result includes a one-time gain of 39 million Canadian dollars.
